card.name: Alabaster Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
When Alabaster Dragon dies, shuffle it into its owner's library.
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : This will always be shuffled into its owner’s library.

card.name: Alluring Scent
card.ability: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
card.flavor: Doom rarely smells this sweet.

card.name: Anaconda
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
card.flavor: Something soft bumped against the rowboat, then was gone.

card.name: Ancestral Memories
card.ability: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If there are less than 7 cards in the library, look at all of them. Put two into your hand, and the rest in the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : This is not considered a draw or a discard.

card.name: Angelic Blessing
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: A peasant can do more by faith than a king by proclamation.

card.name: Archangel
card.ability: Flying, vigilance

card.name: Ardent Militia
card.ability: Vigilance
card.flavor: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fights for hearth and home.

card.name: Armageddon
card.ability: Destroy all lands.
card.flavor:
"‘O miserable of happy Is this the end
Of this new glorious world . . . ?'"
—John Milton, Paradise Lost

card.name: Armored Pegasus
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Asked how it survived a run-in with a bog imp, the pegasus just shook its mane and burped.

card.name: Arrogant Vampire
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Charm and grace may hide a foul heart.

card.name: Assassin's Blade
card.ability:
Cast Assassin's Blade only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Destroy target nonblack attacking creature.

card.name: Balance of Power
card.ability: If target opponent has more cards in hand than you, draw cards equal to the difference.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The number of cards is counted during resolution.

card.name: Baleful Stare
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You draw a card for each Mountain and red card in it.

card.name: Bee Sting
card.ability: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: There are few things as motivating as a swarm of bees.

card.name: Blaze
card.ability: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Blessed Reversal
card.ability: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The creatures are counted on resolution.

card.name: Blinding Light
card.ability: Tap all nonwhite creatures.
card.flavor: Let the unjust avert their faces and contemplate their peril.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Will not tap a creature that is both white and another color.

card.name: Bog Imp
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Don't be fooled by their looks. Think of them as little knives with wings.

card.name: Bog Raiders
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
card.flavor: Those who live amid decay must expect scavengers.

card.name: Bog Wraith
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
card.flavor: It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.

card.name: Boiling Seas
card.ability: Destroy all Islands.
card.flavor: What burns the land, boils the seas.

card.name: Border Guard
card.flavor: "Join the army, see foreign countries" they'd said.

card.name: Breath of Life
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

card.name: Bull Hippo
card.ability: Islandwalk
card.flavor: Stay alert: his lumbering may shake the ground itself, but in water, he glides.

card.name: Burning Cloak
card.ability: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Burning Cloak deals 2 damage to that creature.

card.name: Capricious Sorcerer
card.ability: {T}: Capricious Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

card.name: Charging Bandits
card.ability: Whenever Charging Bandits attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The fear in their victims' eyes is their most cherished reward.

card.name: Charging Paladin
card.ability: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: A true warrior's thoughts are of victory, not death.

card.name: Charging Rhino
card.ability: Charging Rhino can't be blocked by more than one creature.
card.flavor: A rhino rarely uses its horn to announce its charge, only to end it.

card.name: Cloak of Feathers
card.ability:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: A thousand feathers from a thousand birds, sewn with magic and song.

card.name: Cloud Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
Cloud Dragon can block only creatures with flying.

card.name: Cloud Pirates
card.ability:
Flying
Cloud Pirates can block only creatures with flying.

card.name: Cloud Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
Cloud Spirit can block only creatures with flying.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If it loses Flying, it will be unable to block any creatures.

card.name: Command of Unsummoning
card.ability:
Cast Command of Unsummoning only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Return one or two target attacking creatures to their owner's hand.

card.name: Coral Eel
card.flavor: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

card.name: Craven Giant
card.ability: Craven Giant can't block.
card.flavor:
"The best armor is to keep out of range."
—Italian proverb

card.name: Craven Knight
card.ability: Craven Knight can't block.
card.flavor: "I say victory is better than honor."

card.name: Cruel Bargain
card.ability: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.

card.name: Cruel Fate
card.ability: Look at the top five cards of target opponent's library. Put one of those cards into that player's graveyard and the rest on top of his or her library in any order.

card.name: Cruel Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
card.flavor: The more you pay for the lesson, the better you'll remember it.

card.name: Deep Wood
card.ability:
Cast Deep Wood only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.

card.name: Deep-Sea Serpent
card.ability: Deep-Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
card.flavor: Sailors fear the deep-sea serpent; others thank the gods it has no legs.

card.name: Defiant Stand
card.ability:
Cast Defiant Stand only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Target creature gets +1/+3 until end of turn. Untap that creature.

card.name: Déjà Vu
card.ability: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: The past is a mirror of the future.

card.name: Desert Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Never doubt a dragon just because of its size.

card.name: Devastation
card.ability: Destroy all creatures and lands.
card.flavor: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?

card.name: Devoted Hero
card.flavor: The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.

card.name: Djinn of the Lamp
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Once they learn the trick of carrying their own lamps, they never touch the ground again.

card.name: Dread Charge
card.ability: Until end of turn, black creatures you control can be blocked only by black creatures.
card.flavor: "As equal were their souls, so equal was their fate."John Dryden, "Ode to Mrs. Anne Killigrew"

card.name: Dread Reaper
card.ability:
Flying
When Dread Reaper enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.

card.name: Dry Spell
card.ability: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor: A fist of dust to line your throat, a bowl of sand to fill your belly.

card.name: Earthquake
card.ability: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

card.name: Ebon Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
When Ebon Dragon enters the battlefield, you may have target opponent discard a card.

card.name: Elite Cat Warrior
card.ability: Forestwalk
card.flavor: "Hear that? No? That's a cat warrior."

card.name: Elven Cache
card.ability: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Elves know where to harvest the best of the forest, for they planted it themselves.

card.name: Elvish Ranger
card.flavor: It's up to you if you enter their woods—and up to them if you leave.

card.name: Endless Cockroaches
card.ability: When Endless Cockroaches dies, return it to its owner's hand.

card.name: Exhaustion
card.ability: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
10/1/2009 : No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

card.name: False Peace
card.ability: Target player skips all combat phases of his or her next turn.
card.flavor: Mutual consent is not required for war.

card.name: Feral Shadow
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Not all shadows are cast by light—some are cast by darkness.

card.name: Final Strike
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Final Strike, sacrifice a creature.
Final Strike deals damage to target opponent equal to the sacrificed creature's power.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Fire Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
When Fire Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals damage equal to the number of Mountains you control to target creature.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : If there are no other creatures on the battlefield, Fire Dragon will have to target itself. The ability is mandatory.

card.name: Fire Imp
card.ability: When Fire Imp enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.

card.name: Fire Snake
card.ability: When Fire Snake dies, destroy target land.
card.flavor: The snake's final thrashings only spread the fire within it.

card.name: Fire Tempest
card.ability: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

card.name: Flashfires
card.ability: Destroy all Plains.
card.flavor: Dry grass is tinder before the spark.

card.name: Fleet-Footed Monk
card.ability: Fleet-Footed Monk can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or greater.
card.flavor: "Hesitation is for the faithless. My belief lends me speed."

card.name: Flux
card.ability:
Each player discards any number of cards, then draws that many cards.
Draw a card.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The discard is forced even though you choose how many to discard.
4/1/2008 : Each player chooses how many cards he or she would like to discard. That number may be 0.

card.name: Foot Soldiers
card.flavor: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.

card.name: Forked Lightning
card.ability: Forked Lightning deals 4 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : You divide the damage as you cast Forked Lightning, not as it resolves. Each target you choose must be assigned at least 1 damage.

card.name: Fruition
card.ability: You gain 1 life for each Forest on the battlefield.
card.flavor: Come to these woods and suffer no pain; you've burdens to lose and new life to gain.

card.name: Giant Octopus
card.flavor: At the sight of the thing the calamari vendor's eyes went wide, but from fear or avarice none could tell.

card.name: Giant Spider
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: It's not far into the trap, as the crow flies.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Gift of Estates
card.ability: If an opponent controls more lands than you, search your library for up to three Plains cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
8/1/2005 : Gift of Estates does nothing if each of your opponents has the same number of lands or fewer as you.
8/1/2005 : You can find nonbasic lands if they have the Plains land type, such as dual lands (Tundra, et al).

card.name: Goblin Bully
card.flavor: It's easy to stand head and shoulders over those with no backbone.

card.name: Gorilla Warrior
card.flavor: They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.

card.name: Gravedigger
card.ability: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Grizzly Bears
card.flavor: Don't worry about provoking grizzly bears; they come that way.

card.name: Hand of Death
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature.
card.flavor: Death claims all but the darkest souls.

card.name: Harsh Justice
card.ability:
Cast Harsh Justice only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
This turn, whenever an attacking creature deals combat damage to you, it deals that much damage to its controller.

card.name: Highland Giant
card.flavor: Though slow-witted and slow-moving, they are quick to anger.

card.name: Hill Giant
card.flavor: Hill giants are mostly just big. Of course, that does count for a lot

card.name: Horned Turtle
card.flavor: Its spear has no shaft, its shield no handle.

card.name: Howling Fury
card.ability: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: I howl my soul to the moon, and the moon howls with me.

card.name: Hulking Cyclops
card.ability: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
card.flavor: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.

card.name: Hulking Goblin
card.ability: Hulking Goblin can't block.
card.flavor: The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.

card.name: Hurricane
card.ability: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

card.name: Ingenious Thief
card.ability:
Flying
When Ingenious Thief enters the battlefield, look at target player's hand.

card.name: Jungle Lion
card.ability: Jungle Lion can't block.
card.flavor: The lion's only loyalty is to its hunger.

card.name: Keen-Eyed Archers
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: "If it has wings, shoot it. If it doesn't, shoot it anyway."

card.name: King's Assassin
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
card.flavor: Fear is as effective a weapon as the blade.

card.name: Knight Errant
card.flavor:
". . . Before honor is humility."
—The Bible, Proverbs 15:33

card.name: Last Chance
card.ability: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.

card.name: Lava Axe
card.ability: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
card.flavor: Swing your axe as a broom, to sweep away the foe.

card.name: Lava Flow
card.ability: Destroy target creature or land.
card.flavor: People ran as never before at the thought of being buried and cremated at the same time.

card.name: Lizard Warrior
card.flavor: Don't let its appearance frighten you. Let its claws and teeth do that.

card.name: Man-o'-War
card.ability: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It can choose itself. It has to if there are no other creatures.

card.name: Mercenary Knight
card.ability: When Mercenary Knight enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.

card.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
card.flavor: Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?

card.name: Mind Knives
card.ability: Target opponent discards a card at random.
card.flavor: To dodge the unerring knife, one must be free of thought.

card.name: Mind Rot
card.ability: Target player discards two cards.

card.name: Minotaur Warrior
card.flavor: The herd's patience, the stampede's fury.

card.name: Mobilize
card.ability: Untap all creatures you control.
card.flavor: A rested mind is the sharpest weapon.

card.name: Monstrous Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Some cats are born fighters; others need a little persuading.

card.name: Moon Sprite
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor:
"I am that merry wanderer of the night."
—William Shakespeare,
A Midsummer Night's Dream

card.name: Mountain Goat
card.ability: Mountainwalk
card.flavor: Only the heroic and the mad follow mountain goat trails.

card.name: Muck Rats
card.flavor: The difference between a nuisance and a threat is often merely a matter of numbers.

card.name: Mystic Denial
card.ability: Counter target creature or sorcery spell.

card.name: Natural Order
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Natural Order, sacrifice a green creature.
Search your library for a green creature card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The sacrifice of a green creature is part of the cost and is paid on casting. You do not have a choice to pay this cost zero times or more than one time in order to multiply the effect.
10/4/2004 : You do not have to find a green creature card if you do not want to.

card.name: Natural Spring
card.ability: Target player gains 8 life.
card.flavor: Though many have come to this place to wash their wounds, the water has never turned red.

card.name: Nature's Cloak
card.ability: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn.

card.name: Nature's Lore
card.ability: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Nature's secrets can be read on every tree, every branch, every leaf.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
8/1/2008 : You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

card.name: Nature's Ruin
card.ability: Destroy all green creatures.
card.flavor: One chill blast—the exhalation of the grave.

card.name: Needle Storm
card.ability: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.

card.name: Noxious Toad
card.ability: When Noxious Toad dies, each opponent discards a card.

card.name: Omen
card.ability:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.

card.name: Owl Familiar
card.ability:
Flying
When Owl Familiar enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.

card.name: Panther Warriors
card.flavor: The dogs of war are nothing compared to the cats.

card.name: Path of Peace
card.ability: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
card.flavor: The soldier reaped the profits of peace.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the spell fails because the target is not there or isn't legal, the owner does not gain any life.

card.name: Personal Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Phantom Warrior
card.ability: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.
card.flavor: The phantom warrior comes from nowhere and returns there just as quickly.

card.name: Pillaging Horde
card.ability: When Pillaging Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.

card.name: Plant Elemental
card.ability: When Plant Elemental enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice a Forest.

card.name: Primeval Force
card.ability: When Primeval Force enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice three Forests.

card.name: Prosperity
card.ability: Each player draws X cards.
card.flavor: "Life can never be too good."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If both players run out of cards during this effect, the game is a draw.

card.name: Pyroclasm
card.ability: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
card.flavor: Chaos does not choose its enemies.

card.name: Python
card.flavor: What could it have swallowed to grow so large?

card.name: Raging Cougar
card.ability: Haste
card.flavor: Mountaineers quickly learn to travel with their spears always pointed up.

card.name: Raging Goblin
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
card.flavor: Charging alone takes uncommon daring or uncommon stupidity. Or both.

card.name: Raging Minotaur
card.ability: Haste
card.flavor: The only thing worse than a minotaur with an axe is an angry minotaur with an axe.

card.name: Rain of Salt
card.ability: Destroy two target lands.
card.flavor:
It pelts the land with its fury,
spoiling what was once sweet.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You must target two different lands. You can't choose to target just one.

card.name: Rain of Tears
card.ability: Destroy target land.
card.flavor: When emotions rain down, what rivers will be born?

card.name: Raise Dead
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
10/4/2004 : The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Redwood Treefolk
card.flavor: The soldiers chopped and chopped, and still the great tree stood, frowning down at them.

card.name: Regal Unicorn
card.flavor: Unicorns don't care if you believe in them any more than you care if they believe in you.

card.name: Renewing Dawn
card.ability: You gain 2 life for each Mountain target opponent controls.
card.flavor: Dawn brings a new day, and a new day brings hope.

card.name: Rowan Treefolk
card.flavor: One of the forest's best protectors is the forest itself.

card.name: Sacred Knight
card.ability: Sacred Knight can't be blocked by black and/or red creatures.
card.flavor: "No flame, no horror can sway me from my cause."

card.name: Sacred Nectar
card.ability: You gain 4 life.
card.flavor:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "Kubla Khan"

card.name: Scorching Spear
card.ability: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Lift your spear as you might lift your glass, and toast your enemy.

card.name: Scorching Winds
card.ability:
Cast Scorching Winds only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Scorching Winds deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

card.name: Seasoned Marshal
card.ability: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can target an already tapped creature if you want.

card.name: Serpent Assassin
card.ability: When Serpent Assassin enters the battlefield, you may destroy target nonblack creature.

card.name: Serpent Warrior
card.ability: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

card.name: Skeletal Crocodile
card.flavor: The less flesh there is, the more teeth there seem to be.

card.name: Skeletal Snake
card.flavor: They watched as the snake shed layer after layer until only cold bone remained.

card.name: Snapping Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Drakes claim to be dragons—until the dragons show up.

card.name: Sorcerous Sight
card.ability:
Look at target opponent's hand.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Do not react; anticipate.

card.name: Soul Shred
card.ability: Soul Shred deals 3 damage to target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
card.flavor: It would be a shame to let life slip away to nothing.

card.name: Spined Wurm
card.flavor: It has more teeth than fit in its mouth.

card.name: Spiritual Guardian
card.ability: When Spiritual Guardian enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
card.flavor: Hope is born within.

card.name: Spitting Earth
card.ability: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

card.name: Spotted Griffin
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: When the cat flies and the bird stalks, guard your horses carefully.

card.name: Stalking Tiger
card.ability: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.
card.flavor: No one is happy when they notice a tiger.

card.name: Starlight
card.ability: You gain 3 life for each black creature target opponent controls.
card.flavor: Stars are like coins dropped into the night: their light buys safe passage.

card.name: Starlit Angel
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: To soar as high as hope, to dive as swift as justice.

card.name: Steadfastness
card.ability: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Brute force wins the battles. Conviction wins the wars.

card.name: Stern Marshal
card.ability: {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

card.name: Stone Rain
card.ability: Destroy target land.
card.flavor:
I cast a thousand tiny suns—
Beware my many dawns.

card.name: Storm Crow
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Storm crow descending, winter unending.Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

card.name: Summer Bloom
card.ability: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
card.flavor: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

card.name: Sylvan Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Symbol of Unsummoning
card.ability:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
". . . inviting the soul to wander for a spell in abysses of solitude . . . ."
—Kate Chopin, The Awakening

card.name: Taunt
card.ability: During target player's next turn, creatures that player controls attack you if able.

card.name: Temporary Truce
card.ability: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two a player draws this way, that player gains 2 life.

card.name: Theft of Dreams
card.ability: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
card.flavor: Energy is never lost, only transformed.

card.name: Thing from the Deep
card.ability: Whenever Thing from the Deep attacks, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice an Island.
card.flavor: Seafarers fear sailing off the world's edge not so much as down its gullet.

card.name: Thundering Wurm
card.ability: When Thundering Wurm enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a land card.

card.name: Thundermare
card.ability:
Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
When Thundermare enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.

card.name: Tidal Surge
card.ability: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.
card.flavor:
"'Twaswhen the seas were roaring
With hollow blasts of wind . . . ."
—John Gay, "The What D'Ye Call It"

card.name: Time Ebb
card.ability: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.

card.name: Touch of Brilliance
card.ability: Draw two cards.
card.flavor: Acting on one good idea is better than hoarding all the world's knowledge.

card.name: Treetop Defense
card.ability:
Cast Treetop Defense only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Creatures you control gain reach until end of turn. (They can block creatures with flying.)

card.name: Undying Beast
card.ability: When Undying Beast dies, put it on top of its owner's library.

card.name: Untamed Wilds
card.ability: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
10/15/2006 : Can fetch a Snow land.

card.name: Valorous Charge
card.ability: White creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Stand in the way of truth at your peril.

card.name: Vampiric Feast
card.ability: Vampiric Feast deals 4 damage to target creature or player and you gain 4 life.
card.flavor: It's not always gold the thief is after.

card.name: Vampiric Touch
card.ability: Vampiric Touch deals 2 damage to target opponent and you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: A touch, not comforting, but of death.

card.name: Venerable Monk
card.ability: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: His presence brings not only a strong arm but also renewed hope.

card.name: Vengeance
card.ability: Destroy target tapped creature.
card.flavor: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.

card.name: Virtue's Ruin
card.ability: Destroy all white creatures.
card.flavor: All must fall, and those who stand highest fall hardest.

card.name: Volcanic Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

card.name: Volcanic Hammer
card.ability: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Cast the weight as though it were a die, to see a rival's fate.

card.name: Wall of Granite
card.ability: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
card.flavor: The wisest man builds his house behind the rock.

card.name: Wall of Swords
card.ability: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: Sharper than wind, lighter than air.

card.name: Warrior's Charge
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: It is not the absence of fear that makes a warrior, but its domination.

card.name: Whiptail Wurm
card.flavor: It's hard to say for certain which end is more dangerous.

card.name: Wicked Pact
card.ability: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.

card.name: Willow Dryad
card.ability: Forestwalk
card.flavor: Some think that dryads are the dreams of trees.

card.name: Wind Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: "No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings."—William Blake, The Marriage of Heaven and Hell

card.name: Winds of Change
card.ability: Each player shuffles the cards from his or her hand into his or her library, then draws that many cards.
card.ruling: 9/16/2007 : Each player draws a number of cards equal to the number of cards he or she shuffled into his or her own library.

card.name: Winter's Grasp
card.ability: Destroy target land.
card.flavor: Winter settles on the land, and the land prays it will wake.

card.name: Withering Gaze
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You draw a card for each Forest and green card in it.

card.name: Wood Elves
card.ability: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Wrath of God
card.ability: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"As flies to wanton boys, are we to the gods. They kill us for their sport."
—William Shakespeare, King Lear

card.name: Anaconda
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

card.name: Blaze
card.ability: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Fire never dies alone.

card.name: Elite Cat Warrior
card.ability: Forestwalk

card.name: Hand of Death
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature.
card.flavor: Death claims all but the darkest souls.

card.name: Monstrous Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

card.name: Raging Goblin
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

card.name: Warrior's Charge
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
